p: Baseline utilities for adults (≥18 years) and young adults (15 to 17 years) were obtained from the Spanish National Health Survey [ 40]. For children these were derived from García et al. [ 48]. Lost quality-adjusted life years (QALY) due to influenza were calculated from Hollmann et al. [ 49], based on utility loss for inpatient and outpatient settings. Life expectancy data was extracted from Spanish projected mortality tables 2016–2065 [ 50] and was used to calculate the number of LYs lost due to influenza-related deaths.
